intro: Heterotheca scabra var. nuda, commonly known as the naked roughleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are usually rough and hairy, with a distinctive grayish-green color. The flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies.
